intro: Myoxanthus montanus, commonly known as the mountain myoxanthus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and stamens that are prominently displayed. Myoxanthus montanus is adapted to cold, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils at elevations above 3,000 meters.
